# Risclarity

## Company Information

**Name:** Risclarity  
**Website:** https://www.risclarity.com/  
**Category:** Data Integration & Wealth Reporting Platform  

## Support Contact

**Email:** contact@risclarity.com  
**Phone:** 844-598-1100  

## Description

Risclarity is a financial technology company providing data integration and wealth reporting solutions for multi-family offices and registered investment advisor (RIA) firms. The platform specializes in interconnecting existing technology systems through a centralized data hub, enabling seamless integration between portfolio accounting, general ledger, CRM, attribution systems, financial institutions, and custodians.

The company offers comprehensive portfolio accounting capabilities designed to be flexible and adjustable to complex family structures and reporting needs, allowing wealth management firms to provide holistic client service and scale their operations.

## Key Features

### Core Capabilities
- **DataHub Platform:** Centralized data integration hub connecting portfolio accounting, general ledger, CRM, custodians, and financial institutions
- **Data Aggregation:** Consolidate client investment data from custodians, alternative investments, and 3rd-party sources
- **Portfolio Accounting:** Flexible system adjustable to complex family structures and reporting needs
- **Client Reporting:** Customized wealth management and performance reporting
- **Custom Dashboards:** Centralized access to data from disparate systems with workflow integration

### Advanced Features
- **GL Link:** Automated investment data flow into financial accounting systems (reduces manual entry by 20-40 hours/month)
- **Re-Allocator:** Family office-specific rebalancing workflow tool with automated asset allocation shifting
- **New Account Onboarding:** One-click CRM integration for automated form population and e-signature workflow
- **Management Reporting:** Business reports combining financial and non-financial data from all systems
- **CRM Integrations:** Bi-directional sync with Salesforce, Practifi, and other CRMs

### Enterprise-Only Features
- **Back Office Services:** Dedicated client service team for account reconciliation, data management, and troubleshooting
- **Custom Solutions:** Platform can be extended and configured for firm-specific needs
- **API Integration:** Secure and scalable API for custom workflows

### Limitations
- No public pricing transparency (custom quotes only)
- Platform complexity may require dedicated IT resources or Risclarity's service team
- Primarily designed for multi-family offices and larger RIAs (may not be cost-effective for small firms)
- Integration setup can be time-intensive depending on existing tech stack
- Some features require professional services engagement

---

## Add-On Products & Services

### GL Link
**What it does:** Automates the flow of investment data into financial accounting systems (General Ledger), converting single-sided investment data into dual-sided financial accounting entries.

**Key Features:**
- Secure and scalable API integration
- Advanced mapping engine
- Automatic cost basis handling
- Reduces manual data entry by 20-40+ hours per month
- Investment-aware General Ledger for efficient tax preparation

**Pricing:** Contact for quote (enterprise pricing)

**Use Cases:** Multi-family offices and RIAs needing to bridge investment portfolio systems with financial accounting/GL systems (QuickBooks, Sage Intacct, NetSuite, etc.)

### Re-Allocator
**What it does:** Family office-specific rebalancing workflow tool that automates asset allocation shifts and trade determination.

**Key Features:**
- Reduces dependency on Excel-based rebalancing
- Automated trade calculation
- Workflow management for complex family structures
- Integrates with portfolio accounting and custodial systems

**Pricing:** Contact for quote (typically bundled with platform)

**Use Cases:** Family offices managing complex asset allocation models across multiple custodians and family members with automated rebalancing needs.

### Back Office Services
**What it does:** Provides outsourced back-office operations as an extension of client teams.

**Key Services:**
- Account reconciliation (custodial vs. internal records)
- Data management for alternative investments and hard-to-access custodians
- Troubleshooting for reconciliation discrepancies
- Operational support for scaling

**Pricing:** Service-based pricing (contact for quote)

**Use Cases:** Family offices and RIAs looking to scale operations without expanding internal headcount, allowing internal staff to focus on client-facing activities.

### Client Reporting
**What it does:** Augments or replaces existing reporting with customized wealth management and performance reporting.

**Key Features:**
- Beautifully designed custom reports
- Multi-currency performance calculations
- Consolidated wealth views
- Customizable to client branding and needs

**Pricing:** Included with platform or standalone (contact for quote)

**Use Cases:** Firms requiring highly customized client reporting that goes beyond out-of-box solutions from portfolio accounting systems.

### Data Aggregation Services
**What it does:** Consolidates client investment data from multiple sources including alternative investments, custodians, and third-party sources.

**Key Features:**
- Manual and automated data collection
- Alternative investment data capture
- Hard-to-access custodian integration
- Data validation and quality assurance

**Pricing:** Service-based (contact for quote)

**Use Cases:** Family offices with complex holdings including private equity, hedge funds, real estate, and alternative investments not accessible via standard data feeds.

### New Account Onboarding
**What it does:** Automates new account opening across multiple custodians and banks using CRM data, eliminating double-entry.

**Key Features:**
- Pulls client, family, and financial data from CRM
- Multi-custodian account opening workflows
- Eliminates redundant data entry
- Ensures data consistency across systems

**Pricing:** Included with platform integration (contact for quote)

**Use Cases:** Multi-family offices opening accounts across Fidelity, Schwab, Pershing, and other custodians with centralized CRM data.

### Custom Dashboards
**What it does:** Provides custom user interfaces with centralized access to data from disparate systems and workflows.

**Key Features:**
- Tailored to specific operational workflows
- Real-time data from multiple systems
- Integration with industry-leading platforms
- Role-based access and views

**Pricing:** Custom development (contact for quote)

**Use Cases:** Operations teams needing unified views across portfolio accounting, CRM, custodians, and reporting platforms.

### Management Reporting
**What it does:** Creates customized business reports combining financial and non-financial information from all systems.

**Key Features:**
- Aggregates data from all repositories
- Custom business intelligence
- Financial and operational KPIs
- Executive dashboards

**Pricing:** Custom development (contact for quote)

**Use Cases:** Family office leadership teams needing consolidated business performance reporting beyond standard financial statements.

### CRM Integrations
**What it does:** Syncs CRM data with other systems to eliminate outdated and duplicate information across workflows.

**Key Features:**
- Bi-directional CRM sync
- Master data management from CRM
- Eliminates data duplication
- Updates flow to portfolio accounting, custodians, and reporting systems

**Pricing:** Included with platform integration

**Use Cases:** Firms using Salesforce, Redtail, Wealthbox, or other CRMs as the system of record for client/family data.

## Evaluation Notes

### Strengths (Pros)
1. **Purpose-built for family office complexity** — DataHub platform specifically designed to handle multi-generational family structures, complex entity relationships, and diverse asset types common in family offices and multi-family offices.

2. **Centralized data integration hub** — Acts as middleware connecting portfolio accounting, CRM, general ledger, attribution systems, custodians, and other platforms into a unified ecosystem, eliminating data silos.

3. **Family office-specific tools** — Offers specialized solutions like Re-Allocator (rebalancing for complex families) and GL Link (investment→accounting automation) that address niche family office pain points not solved by standard RIA platforms.

4. **Customization and flexibility** — Platform can be tailored to unique workflows, reporting requirements, and operational models rather than forcing firms into rigid out-of-box processes.

5. **Service + software model** — Combines technology platform with experienced back-office service teams (reconciliation, data management, troubleshooting) to augment client operations.

6. **Proven operational efficiencies** — GL Link alone saves firms 20-40+ hours per month in manual data entry; overall platform enables scaling without proportional headcount increases.

7. **Award-winning platform** — Recognized as "Denver Best Places to Work 2025" and noted for innovation in family office technology space.

### Weaknesses (Cons)
1. **Limited pricing transparency** — No public pricing available; requires sales consultation, making it difficult for prospects to assess budget fit without engagement.

2. **Niche market focus** — Primarily serves multi-family offices and high-end RIAs; may be over-engineered and cost-prohibitive for smaller advisory firms or single-family offices with simpler needs.

3. **Implementation complexity** — Service-heavy, customization-first approach likely requires significant onboarding time, change management, and ongoing professional services vs. quick SaaS deployment.

4. **Service dependency** — While back-office services are a strength, firms may become reliant on Risclarity for operational tasks, creating vendor lock-in and potentially higher long-term costs.

5. **Limited public documentation** — Website offers high-level overviews but lacks detailed product specs, user guides, API docs, or integration catalogs accessible to prospects during evaluation.

### Use Cases

**Ideal For:**
- **Multi-family offices (MFOs)** managing 10+ family relationships with complex structures, multiple entities, and diverse asset types requiring centralized data management.
- **Single-family offices with $500M+ AUM** needing enterprise-grade integration, custom reporting, and operational automation beyond basic portfolio accounting.
- **Wealth management firms with fragmented tech stacks** running separate systems for portfolio accounting, CRM, financial accounting, and reporting that need middleware to unify data.
- **Family offices with heavy alternative investment exposure** (private equity, hedge funds, real estate) requiring manual data aggregation and specialized reporting.
- **Growing family offices seeking operational leverage** that want to scale client capacity without proportionally increasing back-office headcount.

**Not Ideal For:**
- **Small RIAs (<$500M AUM)** with straightforward tech stacks (e.g., Orion + Redtail + Riskalyze) that don't require complex middleware or custom integration.
- **Firms needing out-of-box solutions** that want quick SaaS deployment with standard workflows rather than multi-month implementations with customization.
- **Budget-conscious firms seeking transparent pricing** — lack of public pricing and service-heavy model likely positions Risclarity at premium price points.
- **DIY firms preferring self-service** — Platform appears to require ongoing professional services and support rather than self-service configuration.
- **Retail-focused advisors** managing 1031 households with similar needs; Risclarity's customization and complexity overkill for standardized retail wealth management.

### Key Differentiators
1. **DataHub as centralized integration hub** — Unlike point solutions, Risclarity positions itself as the connective tissue between all systems (portfolio accounting, CRM, GL, custodians), acting as middleware rather than replacing existing tech.

2. **Family office-first design philosophy** — Built specifically for multi-generational family complexity (trusts, entities, estates) vs. general RIA platforms retrofitted for family offices.

3. **GL Link investment→accounting bridge** — Unique solution automating the notoriously manual process of translating investment activity into dual-entry accounting for General Ledger systems, saving 20-40+ hours/month.

4. **Service + software hybrid model** — Combines platform with back-office services (reconciliation, data management, troubleshooting) rather than pure software licensing, providing operational leverage.

5. **Customization-first approach** — Emphasizes tailoring workflows, reports, and integrations to each firm's specific needs vs. forcing standardization; positions as bespoke solution provider.

### Alternatives & Comparisons

**Addepar**
- Broader wealth management platform with institutional focus
- Larger enterprise client base (1000+ firms)
- More robust data analytics and portfolio insights
- Higher pricing tier, longer sales cycles
- Less family office-specific than Risclarity

**Black Diamond (SS&C)**
- RIA-focused platform for portfolio management and reporting
- More out-of-box functionality, less customization
- Stronger advisor workflow features
- Better for growth RIAs vs. multi-family offices
- Lower price point, faster implementation

**FactSet**
- Institutional-grade data and analytics platform
- Stronger investment research and market data
- Less operational/back-office focus
- Higher cost, more complex for family offices
- Better for asset managers than wealth managers

**Tamarac (Envestnet)**
- Advisor-focused rebalancing, reporting, and CRM
- Strong integration with Envestnet ecosystem
- Better for retail RIAs than family offices
- More standardized workflows
- Lower customization, faster deployment

**Proprietary/In-House Systems**
- Maximum control and customization
- High development and maintenance costs
- Requires dedicated IT/engineering teams
- No vendor support or upgrades
- Risk of technical debt and talent dependency
